description: man wearing a coat, kneeling on a chair in a corner
image_copyright: Photograph by Irving Penn%2C © by Irving Penn
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date, Inscription and Stamp

on back, in pencil: [Early Print / GP. (?) / Print made near to date of / photograph.] and various notes
markings: on back, stamped in black: copyright stamp, artist\'s name stamp and edition stamp
signed: on back, in pencil: [Irving Penn] and [TRUMAN CAPOTE / (March 5, 1948  New York)]
text: Irving Penn’s portrait of author Truman Capote (1924–1984) is a widely recognized photograph. Taken when Capote was 24 years old and gaining critical recognition for his short stories, the portrait is anything but a celebration of the author’s confidence. With his hands shoved into his pockets, his legs tucked up and hidden in a too-big coat, and his body wedged in a corner of the photographer’s studio, the portrait instead captures Capote’s vulnerability at a pivotal moment in his career.
title: Truman Capote, New York
